task_summary: The robot is instructed to pick the tube object located on the black shelf, as evidenced by the sequential movements displayed in frames 0 to 8.

task_long_description.overview: A blue robotic arm is tasked to pick a small white cylindrical tube from a black shelving unit in a kitchen-like environment. The sequence begins with perception, proceeds through gripper opening and alignment, then gripping and lifting of the tube. There is only one target object ('tube') to be handled, which sits beside a larger white cup. The task demands precise manipulation and stable grasp.
preconditions: Robot arm is operational and within workspace reach.
The tube is present and unobstructed on the shelf.
No objects are blocking the approach.
stepwise_plan: Check visibility of the tube; scan if not visible.
Detect the precise location of the tube.
Open the gripper to allow grasping.
Move to a position above the tube.
Approach and align gripper with the tube.
Grasp at calculated pose using top strategy.
success_criteria: Tube is securely gripped by the gripper.
Tube is lifted and no longer in its initial position.
No collision with shelf or other objects.
failure_and_recovery: Grasp failed: Re-open gripper, re-approach, retry grasp.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when tube is gripped and lifted (robot retreats with object).

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the tube is visible to the perception system.
Scans the scene for the tube if not visible.
Performs tube pose detection for manipulation.
Opens gripper to 6cm width to prepare for grasping.
Moves gripper to 5cm above tube for top-down approach.
Computes a top-down grasp pose and saves to std_top.
Approaches and aligns gripper above tube precisely.
Executes grasp at computed pose using top strategy.
Checks if the tube is being gripped securely.
Retreats and lifts tube by 10cm after grasping.

failure_modes: Tube not detected in field of view.
Tube slips or not secured in gripper.
recovery_strategy: Retry scan or detection if tube is not visible.
Retry grasp if tube is not in gripper.
Abort mission if repeated failures persist.
assumptions: The smaller white cylinder is the 'tube' to be picked; the larger is not selected per frames.
All perception steps complete successfully unless scan fallback is invoked.
Top grasp is most suitable based on shelf layout and arm pose.

expected_success_criteria: Tube is no longer on the shelf and is secured in the gripper after retreating.
